radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases are clear. The liver shows no focal lesion or intrahepatic biliary dilatation. The gallbladder shows no stones or wall edema. Spleen is normal in size. The adrenal glands and pancreas show no masses. The kidneys enhance with and excrete contrast symmetrically. Small and large bowel show no evidence of obstruction or wall edema. There is no free air, free fluid or lymphadenopathy. The appendix is visualized in the right lower quadrant and demonstrates wall edema and measures 12 mm in diameter. There is no periappendiceal fluid collection. The appendix is situated in an anterior/inferior position with respect to the cecum.
